Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti
Description: This small terracotta shabti is of very mediocre work. The different parts of the face (the eyebrows, the eyes, the nose and the mouth), just as the hands, which hold two hoes, are indicated by  single black-coloured marks. Under the crossed arms we find several partially effaced hieroglyphs, mentioning the name of the deceased. On the front side of the statuette, one sees also the small sack which is normally hangs on the back.
